channel.title: Hosting My Server WITHOUT Port Forwarding
channel.description:
Hey there,
For a few reasons, ones I will not go into right now, I cannot port forward a port for use with a Private server, so I was hoping that one of the Moparscape knowledgeable users here could give me ways to host without port forwarding.
I heard of a way to do it via µTorrent, however, I haven't successfully managed to get that one to work. I personally can connect to it, but no one else can. I haven't tried anyone else on my home network though, just people on separate ones over the internet.
So any and all help regarding the µTorrent issue, or a new one would be greatly appreciated!
Spar.

item.title: Hosting My Server WITHOUT Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Sparhawk Sparhawk
item.description:
@Sparhawk wrote:

[quote=“P I M P 3 D Tut, post:21, topic:273368”][quote author=Sparhawk link=topic=361270.msg2748054#msg2748054 date=1239744913]

Is there more info on how to do the µTorrent way? I can’t get it to work

Pain in the ass…

Lol I’ll take that as a compliment should I ? :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2009, 03:58:05 pm[/size][hr]Does ANYONE know?
[/quote]
He doesn’t mean your a pain in the ass, He means Utorrent is a pain in the ass.[/quote]

Holy Quotes in Quotes O.O

Anyway, Granted, it’s a pain in the ass, but do you know how to get it to work? :D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 16, 2009, 02:12:22 pm[/size][hr]need help here XD

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting My Server WITHOUT Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Sparhawk Sparhawk
item.description:
@Sparhawk wrote:

[quote=“God Of Love, post:18, topic:273368”]VPS are dedicated hosts that you can run your server on - They cost money but they are worth it. I just baught mine from VPSland.com
Cheapest is like 12$ or seomthing- thats all it costs. Or you can always run it off Hamachi, But nobody plays Hamachi Servers nowadays.
~God Of Love.[/quote]

Sounds useful that, cheers

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting My Server WITHOUT Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Sparhawk Sparhawk
item.description:
@Sparhawk wrote:

p3r$0n:

vps is only way w/out port forwarding, but its not free

What is VPs?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 12:56:24 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Xaros, post:13, topic:273368”][quote author=Sparhawk link=topic=361270.msg2748908#msg2748908 date=1239797895]

without portforwarding? well. hamachi.

I’d really hate it to come to that X_X
[/quote]
Well… It actualy depends on whats youre gateway… And youre router… Tell me it, maybe i can help with that.
Lol its easy for me i just select whats running and allow it then click always :)[/quote]

But wouldn’t my ISP Have to allow port forwarding regardless of my Router?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 12:57:38 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Fallen127, post:14, topic:273368”]the quickest and easiest way to host a server without port forwarding is making a static ip and using that as the address to you No-ip.[/quote]

How on earth do you do that?? pls tell

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting My Server WITHOUT Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Sparhawk Sparhawk
item.description:
@Sparhawk wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:8, topic:273368”][quote author=Sparhawk link=topic=361270.msg2748127#msg2748127 date=1239747149]

I would say there isn’t a way to host a server without port forwarding…there is always hamachi, but im sure you like your computer enough to not get it crashed.

Lol, very true. So that’s it then? I either get a wireless connection or don’t host it?
[/quote]
Are you currently using a router to connect to the internet? If not, you do not need to portforward.[/quote]

Unfortunately so. My ISP basically has a physical block on port forwarding

Read full topic
